javadoc: A dialog that allows the user to choose from available data types or create new ones.

methods.javadoc:
If true then a Tab key press will work the same as pressing the Enter key. If false, then a Tab key press will trigger navigation, as is normally done in Java.

This method is useful for widgets that have embedded editors that launch this dialog. For these editors, like tables, it is nice to be able to tab through various editors. This method allows these editors to keep this functionality, even though a new dialog was shown. @see #wasClosedByTab
methods.name: setTabCommitsEdit
methods.comment:
If true then a Tab key press will work the same as pressing the Enter key.  If false, then
 a Tab key press will trigger navigation, as is normally done in Java.  
 
 This method is useful for widgets that have embedded editors that launch this dialog.  For
 these editors, like tables, it is nice to be able to tab through various editors.  This
 method allows these editors to keep this functionality, even though a new dialog was shown.

methods.javadoc:
Sets the value that this dialog will display in it's editor when initially shown.
@param dataType The initial data type to use for editing.
methods.name: setInitialDataType
methods.comment: Sets the value that this dialog will display in it's editor when initially shown.

params.name: dataType
params.comment: The initial data type to use for editing.

methods.javadoc:
Clears the last user selection.  This is useful if this dialog is reused and the call
 wants to make sure that old selections do not appear later.
methods.name: clearUserChosenDataType
methods.comment:
Clears the last user selection.  This is useful if this dialog is reused and the call
 wants to make sure that old selections do not appear later.

methods.javadoc:
The data type choice of the user or null if the dialog was cancelled.
@return The data type choice of the user or null if the dialog was cancelled.
methods.name: getUserChosenDataType
methods.comment: The data type choice of the user or null if the dialog was cancelled.

return.comment: The data type choice of the user or null if the dialog was cancelled.

name: DataTypeSelectionDialog
comment: A dialog that allows the user to choose from available data types or create new ones.
